org.qualitune.naoservice.client
Class Nao.ALBluetooth

java.lang.Object
  org.qualitune.naoservice.client.Nao.ALBluetooth
Enclosing class:
Nao
public static final class Nao.ALBluetooth
extends java.lang.Object

This module handle one or several Aldebaran's bluetooth boards.

wait

public org.json.JSONObject wait(int id,
                                int timeoutperiod)
Wait for the end of a long running method that was called using 'post'

Parameters:
id - The ID of the method that was returned when calling the method using 'post'
timeoutPeriod - The timeout period in ms. To wait indefinately, use a timeoutPeriod of zero.
Actual SDK return value:True if the timeout period terminated. False if the method returned.
Returns:
JSONObject which contains the following values as strings:
  • the actual return value (returnvalue)
  • exceptions (exception)
  • standard out (stdout)
  • standard err (err)

Scan for bluetooth devices, this may take up to 10 seconds
Actual SDK return value: a list of bluetooth devices

send

public org.json.JSONObject send(java.lang.String devicename,
                                java.lang.String pwms,
                                java.lang.String servos,
                                java.lang.String gpios)
Send data to a bluetooth device, each value should be provided.

Parameters:
devicename - the device name
PWMs - array of 4 signed short, should be between -32768 and 32768 (duty cycle ranging from -100% to 100%)
servos - array of 2 unsigned short, should be between 500 and 2500 (pulse width in microsecond)
GPIOs - array of 4 bool
Returns:
JSONObject which contains the following values as strings:
  • the actual return value (returnvalue)
  • exceptions (exception)
  • standard out (stdout)
  • standard err (err)

setAssociatedDeviceList

public org.json.JSONObject setAssociatedDeviceList(java.lang.String devicelist)
set the device list that nao should handle. Association will be persistent after reboot.

Parameters:
deviceList - list of bluetooth device
Returns:
JSONObject which contains the following values as strings:
  • the actual return value (returnvalue)
  • exceptions (exception)
  • standard out (stdout)
  • standard err (err)
